title: How to Make Peanut Butter Cup Cupcakes

steps.headline: Line all the 2 1/2-inch muffin cups with cupcake liners; set aside.
Place cake mix, chocolate milk, oil, peanut butter and eggs in a large mixing bowl.
Beat on low speed for 30 seconds using an electric mixer.
Scrape down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula; beat on medium speed for one minute.
Fill each lined muffin cup two-thirds full carefully using a ladle.
steps.description: Place muffin pans in preheated oven.

steps.headline: Bake for 21-26 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cupcake comes out clean (with no batter stuck to it).
Using oven mitts, remove from oven.
steps.description: Place on racks; let them stand for about 30 minutes or until completely cool.

steps.headline: Combine pudding mix, milk and peanut butter for the filling in another large mixing bowl.
steps.description: Using a whisk, beat for two minutes until smooth and thickened.

steps.headline: Place in refrigerator; chill for thirty minutes.
Spoon filling into a pastry bag fitted with a medium round tip.
steps.description: Fill cupcakes by inserting tip into the top of each cupcake and squeezing about two tablespoons of filling into each.

steps.headline: Spread frosting on cupcakes using an icing spatula.

text: Making the Cupcakes Preheat oven to 350ºF/180ºC.  Line all the 2 1/2-inch muffin cups with cupcake liners; set aside.  Place cake mix, chocolate milk, oil, peanut butter and eggs in a large mixing bowl.  Beat on low speed for 30 seconds using an electric mixer.  Scrape down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula; beat on medium speed for one minute.  Fill each lined muffin cup two-thirds full carefully using a ladle. Place muffin pans in preheated oven. Bake for 21-26 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cupcake comes out clean (with no batter stuck to it).  Using oven mitts, remove from oven. Place on racks; let them stand for about 30 minutes or until completely cool. Finished.  Making the Icing Combine pudding mix, milk and peanut butter for the filling in another large mixing bowl. Using a whisk, beat for two minutes until smooth and thickened. Place in refrigerator; chill for thirty minutes.  Spoon filling into a pastry bag fitted with a medium round tip. Fill cupcakes by inserting tip into the top of each cupcake and squeezing about two tablespoons of filling into each. Spread frosting on cupcakes using an icing spatula.
